properties.Name: Scope3Category3FuelAndEnergyRelatedEmissionsAverageDataMethod
properties.Description:
This activity includes the extraction, production, and transportation of fuels consumed by the reporting company.

Companies may use either of the following methods to calculate scope 3 emissions from upstream emissions of purchased fuels:

- Average-data method, which involves estimating emissions by using secondary (e.g., industry average) emission factors for upstream emissions per unit of consumption (e.g., kg CO2 e/kWh).

Columns.Name: ReportingLegalEntityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Legal Entity.

Columns.Name: FuelTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a fuel type.

Columns.Name: FuelConsumedQuantityUomId
Columns.Description: The fuel consumption units of measure.

Columns.Name: FuelPurchasedValueAmount
Columns.Description: The retail value of the fuel purchased.

Columns.Name: FuelPurchasedCurrencyId
Columns.Description: The currency associated with the fuel purchased amount.

Columns.Name: FuelResoldQuantityUnits
Columns.Description: The fuel quantity units that was purchased and is resold.

Columns.Name: FuelResoldQuantityUomId
Columns.Description: The fuel resold quantity units of measure.

Columns.Name: TotalCo2EEmissionsUomId
Columns.Description: The emission factor units of measure.

Companies may use either of the following methods to calculate scope 3 emissions from upstream emissions of purchased fuels:
